stories.headline: CAR in Latin America
stories.summary: Latin American journalists, led by figures like Carlos Subero, are increasingly adopting computer-assisted reporting techniques to enhance their investigative prowess in areas like political analysis and crime reporting.

stories.headline: Busted Tracking Bankruptcy
stories.summary: Stefan Lisinski investigates the correlation between bankruptcy and economic criminality in Sweden, using data analysis to reveal how bankruptcy is used by criminals as a business tool.

stories.headline: Tax Investigation
stories.summary: An in-depth analysis of property tax trends in New Jersey reveals significant increases during the 1990s, conducted with computer-assisted reporting methods.
